programme.title: Angry Planet S3 - "Under Pressure"
programme.desc: George begins his exploration of the deep with a well-preserved shipwreck in the st.lawrence River, then heads west to dive with undersea explorers Chris Harvey-Clark and Phil Nuyyton, and investigate the newly discovered “Black Smoker” deepsea vents

programme.title: Angry Planet S3 - "Crystal Cave"
programme.desc: A remarkable find was made in Chihuahua, Mexico, of a spectacular cave filled with giant crystals. George leads an Explorers Club Flag Expedition into the cave, wearing special refrigerated suits and respirators to battle the extreme environment

programme.title: Ocean Vet S1 - "The Galapagos Shark"
programme.desc: Follow the team as they risk their lives to transport the shark 10 miles off shore for release in a protected marine reserve.

programme.title: Ocean Vet S1 - "Eagle Rays"
programme.desc: Teaming up with international scientist Dr Matt Ajemian and eagle ray wrangler Chris Flook the team face a tricky task to capture one of the most intelligent fish in the ocean in some of Bermudas most beautiful surroundings.

programme.title: Ocean Vet S1 - "Tiger Taggers"
programme.desc: Follow the team as they struggle to catch and tag the biggest tiger shark they’ve ever encountered as they complete their mission to help study, save and protect this incredible shark species.

programme.title: Ocean Vet S1 - "The Mighty Marlin"
programme.desc: Watch as Neil and the Ocean Vet team wrestle a monster blue marlin to the side of the boat to attach a satellite tag that will expand the scientific knowledge of this species by revealing its oceanic migrations.

programme.title: How Do They Do It S13 - "Snails/Cutlery/Fishing Kayaks"
programme.desc: How do they feed France’s appetite for snails? How do they turn slabs of steel into shiny cutlery? How do they craft a kayak you can paddle with your feet?

programme.title: How Do They Do It S13 - "Emergency Bridges/Marker Pens/Electric superbike"
programme.desc: How do they build emergency bridges that can take the weight of a tank? How do they make a marker pen that never fades? How do they design a 200 mph superbike?

programme.title: How Do They Do It S13 - "Crystal Glass/Flat Screen TVs/Deepest Pool/Ketchup"
programme.desc: How do they blow the world’s finest crystal wine glasses? How do they make the world’s slimmest TVs? How do they heat the world’s deepest swimming pool? How do they fill a million bottles a day of the world’s favourite ketchup?

programme.title: How Do They Do It S13 - "Pulverizer/Bomber Jackets/Lambic Beer/"
programme.desc: How do they forge a set of jaws that can chomp through concrete and demolish tower blocks? How do they stitch the historic airman’s bomber? How do they brew the oldest beer in the Western World?

programme.title: Space Greed S1 - "Looting The Moon For Trillions of Dollars"
programme.sub-title: Looting The Moon For Trillions of Dollars
programme.desc: With NASA planning to make a manned return trip to the moon by 2024, how long until some giant corporation turns moon dust into a cosmic-sized payday?

programme.title: Secrets of the Brain S1 - "Seeing is Believing"
programme.desc: Jack meets a man who has bizarre hallucinations and witnesses cutting edge surgery.

programme.title: Quick Connections with Alie Ward S1 - "Fighting Mortality"
programme.desc: What is the secret to eternal life? Alie Ward goes from an ancient herbal remedy to arrive at embryonic stem cells and the tantalising prospect of a future where we could be forever young.

programme.title: The New Frontier S4 - "Mercury or Bust"
programme.desc: The ESA - JAXA joint Bepi-Colombo Mission is moments away from launch. The target is Mercury which has been too long neglected; this mission will shed new light on this strange world of light and dark.

programme.title: The New Frontier S4 - "Hyabusa2"
programme.desc: The Japanese Asteroid sample return mission has reached its target and is surveying the space rock ready to dip down and take a sample. The return of asteroid material to Earth will aid scientists in the evolving asteroid planetary defense systems.

programme.title: The New Frontier S4 - "Eyes to the Heavens"
programme.desc: Two new space telescopes are in orbit and completing their shakedown; Gaia and TESS they too will be joined by the James Webb Telescope. Together they will be opening up a whole new vista into time and space.

programme.title: The New Frontier S4 - "Martian Attractions"
programme.desc: The Latest in Martian exploration from orbit and on the ground, new sources of water and planetary dust storms are a few of the stories unfolding on to the Red Planet.

programme.title: How Do They Do It S14 - "Crash Testing, Delftware, Umbrellas"
programme.desc: How do they blend science and destruction at crash test centres? And how do they piece together the complex mechanism of a pocket sized umbrella?

programme.title: How Do They Do It S14 - "Iron Ore, Wave Flume, Chandeliers"
programme.desc: How do they extract iron ore from one of the most remote mines on the planet? And how do they make chandeliers that are fit for a queen?

programme.title: How Do They Do It S14 - "Oyster Knives, Stadium Lights, Diamonds"
programme.desc: How do they forge the blades to crack open oyster shells? Plus, how do scientists in a lab grow the synthetic diamonds of the future?

programme.title: How Do They Do It S14 - "Cheddar Cheese, CPR Mannequins, Dishwashers"
programme.desc: How do they make cheddar, the world's most popular cheese? How do they breathe life into Rususci Anne - the plastic woman that teaches CPR?

programme.title: Xploration DIY Sci S5 - "Garage Science"
programme.desc: Host Steve Spangler and his sidekick Higginsworth explore science experiments you can do in your own garage.

programme.title: Xploration DIY Sci S5 - "Art Science"
programme.desc: Host Steve Spangler and his sidekick Higginsworth explore new ways to create art, using science.

programme.title: Xploration DIY Sci S5 - "Classroom: Impossible"
programme.desc: Fourth grade teacher Sandra Sanchez has a problem – her class is a year behind in science after a season of virtual-only teaching.

programme.title: Xploration DIY Sci S5 - "Museum Of Science, Boston #1"
programme.desc: Host Steve Spangler and his sidekick Higginsworth explore the Museum of Science, Boston, for new do-it-yourself science tricks and experiments.

programme.title: Bright Now S1 - "The Wright Brothers: Bravery"
programme.desc: Just over 100 years ago, a pair of brothers looked at the sky and changed the world. They designed, built and flew the most ridiculous of inventions. How did two bicycle mechanics manage to succeed where the others had failed?

programme.title: Bright Now S1 - "Chungungo: The World's Smallest Otter"
programme.desc: Meet a family of Chungungos, the world's mysterious, smallest otter. Living along the untamed coast of the southern Pacific Ocean, these furry, intelligent, and adorable creatures make their home in the wild of Chile.

programme.title: Bright Now S1 - "Growing Up Hadzabe"
programme.desc: Our earliest ancestors, before developing agriculture as a source of food, formed what is considered hunter-gather societies. The Hadzabe of Tanzania are considered one of the last of these tribes on the planet.

programme.title: Bright Now S1 - "Tastes Like T-Rex"
programme.desc: Modern birds are the most direct descendants of some of the most iconic dinosaurs to ever walk on this planet. Bue can science really enable us to alter chicken embryos to resemble their mightiest ancestor: T-Rex?

programme.title: Rethink S1 - "Penrose Triangle and The Brain Illusion Pareidolia"
programme.sub-title: Penrose Triangle and The Brain Illusion Pareidolia
programme.desc: In a world where nothing is what it seems we’ll take a look at impossible objects such as the penrose triangle, the brain illusion pareidolia and explore the phenomenon of levitation.

programme.title: Rethink S1 - "The Magic of Newtonian Fluids"
programme.desc: In a world where nothing is what it seems we’ll explain optical illusions like forced perspective, introduce you to the magic of Newtonian fluids and take an in - depth look at the magic bed of nails trick.

programme.title: Rethink S1 - "Grandfather Paradox and Time Travel"
programme.desc: In a world where nothing is what it seems, let’s explain Ambigram’s and how they trick you plus we’ll discover the Grandfather paradox and the question of time travel. Finally we’ll put your ears to the test with the Shepard Tone illusion.

programme.title: Rethink S1 - "McGurk Effect Phenomenon"
programme.desc: Lets take a look at the art movement photorealism and another test for your ears in the McGurk Effect phenomenon. We’ll take you back in time to introduce you to Peppers ghost and highlight famous forward thinker Leonardo Da Vinci.

programme.title: Power & S3 - "Glima - Bjørn Braathen"
programme.desc: Bjørn Braathen is a young man and a passionate Glima (Norwegian wrestling) champion. This is the Art of the Norwegian Vikings, the special forces of their time.

programme.title: Power & S3 - "Shaolin Kung Fu - Kirby Koo"
programme.desc: Kirby Koo is a Shaolin Kung Fu Martial Artist and yoga teacher who lives in New York City and trains with Shi Yan Ming, a 34rd generation Shaolin warrior monk.

programme.title: Power & S3 - "Kapap - Amit Himelstein"
programme.desc: Amit Himelstein is the head instructor of the IKF and the leader in Kapap. His big motto? Respect everyone but fear no-one. He’s the embodiment of krav maga.

programme.title: Power & S3 - "Kickboxing - Denise Kielholtz"
programme.desc: Denise Kielholtz is 6 time world champion kickboxer. Her goal? To become the world’s first female MMA world champion and will do anything to achieve this.

programme.title: Sci Q S1 - "Who’s the Smartest in the Room?"
programme.sub-title: Who’s the Smartest in the Room?
programme.desc: Fast-paced, pop-science show that will test your science I.Q. Where’s the hottest place in North America? Does a camel’s hump store water or fat? Our planet is moving through space at 67,000 mph, so why don’t we feel it moving?

programme.title: Sci Q S1 - "Dare to be Smart"
programme.desc: Fast-paced, pop-science show that will test your science I.Q. When was the first virtual-reality headset created? What is hydroponic farming? What’s the difference between a grizzly bear and a brown bear?

programme.title: Sci Q S1 - "Sci Smarts"
programme.desc: Fast-paced, pop-science show that will test your science I.Q. What’s the name of the largest fault line in California? How does the Venus Flytrap catch bugs? Is the far side of the moon always dark?

programme.title: Sci Q S1 - "Sci Quiz"
programme.desc: Fast-paced, pop-science show that will test your science I.Q. How long can a person exist without water? How fast is the International Space Station travelling through space? What exactly are DNA Forensics?

programme.title: More Curious? S1 - "What are the many functions of our Nose?"
programme.sub-title: What are the many functions of our Nose?
programme.desc: Bass describes musical instruments with a low or deep frequency, passports are essential for global travel and what are the many functions of our Nose? Other topics covered include Blood pressure, Cinema, Pop and Comics.

programme.title: More Curious? S1 - "What are blades?"
programme.desc: What is asphalt and how is it used? What are blades? Discover dishwashers and Irons and explore Greek mythology. Plus many more questions answered in this episode of More Curious.

programme.title: More Curious? S1 - "From Blenders to Boomerangs"
programme.desc: From blenders to boomerangs, air fryers to mummies, learn about the in’s and out’s of these items and topics plus an in depth look at e - sports covered in this episode.

programme.title: More Curious? S1 - "What are acoustics?"
programme.desc: This episode answers the big questions. What are acoustics? How can you learn to code? What are fiber optics, and how effective are herbal medicines? Plus much more!

programme.title: Xploration Outer Space S3 - "A Space Station for All"
programme.desc: Host Emily Calandrelli explores what kind of experiments are being conducted on the International Space Station that will benefit humans on earth.

programme.title: Xploration Outer Space S3 - "Mars vs. the Moon"
programme.desc: Host Emily Calandrelli investigates this dilemma which will determine our space-faring future.

programme.title: Xploration Outer Space S4 - "Landing on Mars"
programme.desc: Host Emily Calandrelli looks at the varied and ingenious methods used to land spacecraft on the red planet, starting with Pathfinder in 1997.

programme.title: Xploration Outer Space S4 - "A Year of Space Odyssey"
programme.desc: Host Emily Calandrelli explores the amazing journeys of spacecraft that gathered spectacular images of Mercury, Jupiter and Mars.

programme.title: The Re-Inventors S2 - "Fire Fighting"
programme.desc: It's literally a baptism by fire for two old flame-fighting patents. Will they pass the test or go up in smoke?

programme.title: The Re-Inventors S2 - "Double-Barreled Cannon"
programme.desc: Today we will resurrect a cannon used in the American Civil War.

programme.title: The Re-Inventors S3 - "Davis Life Pod"
programme.desc: Today we will try an invention that can save lives at sea.

programme.title: Extremes S1 - "Tall Buildings, Fast Animals and Expensive Cities"
programme.sub-title: Tall Buildings, Fast Animals and Expensive Cities
programme.desc: In this episode of Extremes, we explore tall buildings, fast animals, expensive cities and extremely impressive basketball records.

programme.title: Extremes S1 - "Long Lives, Destructive Weather and Speed Records"
programme.sub-title: Long Lives, Destructive Weather and Speed Records
programme.desc: In this episode of Extremes, you will learn about extreme close-up photography, long lives, destructive weather and speed records.

programme.title: Extremes S1 - "Physics, Space and Wealth"
programme.desc: In this episode of Extremes, we’ll explore all things extreme in physics, space and wealth plus take a look at the smallest creatures on Earth.
